attributes.action: Review the grading system used for this year's A-level and GCSE results
attributes.additional_details:
Instead of closing the attainment gap, the algorithm used to calculate grades for this year's cohort of A-level and GCSE students both reinforces educational inequality and undermines the hard work of both teachers and students by largely ignoring the centre assessed grade for larger cohorts, relying on statistical modelling instead. 

After 5 months of waiting, it is unfair to withhold such information at a critical moment in their lives, with many relying on universities to offer them places.
attributes.background: We would like the government to intervene and re-evalute the algorithm used to calculate this year's results. By basing results on factors that have little to do with a student (other cohort's attainment, their school) Ofqual has created a classist system that will inevitably disadvantage many.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign these petitions instead:

Review the decision to use previous data to calculate exam grades: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/306773 

Review the standardisation of grades so state school pupils aren't disadvantaged: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/325422 

Remove Ofqual's moderation of 2020 results based on schools previous performance: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/328957 

Reverse all exam grades back to teacher’s own predictions: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/334491 

Work with regulators and exam providers to clarify exam arrangements for 2021: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/312570
